Portal 2 is a sequel with a larger scope and budget. It was enjoyable for the gameplay and puzzles. The story was fine. I prefer Portal One's story over this sequel. I would not call it bloat, but the game went too long for the story. The game presented itself as the puzzles were created first and then story. 

The sequel has a moderate rumbling of a soundtrack. The visuals are sharper and the physics engine is neat. This is not a bad game, but an enjoyable sequel for those wanting more of Portal.
Best sequel to a valve game EVER!

This game is disappointing. The story is funny, witty, and engaging, however the gameplay is weak. The first third of the game is made up of extremely simple puzzles with a couple more challenging ones at the end, then you have the middle third which is mostly going from place to place with very few simple puzzles in between, and the last part of the game has a couple clever puzzles but thats it. The puzzles here have only one solution - there is no room to be creative. There are very few tiles on which you can place portals - it feels very restrictive and simplistic. 

I was expecting the game to start simple, introducing you to concepts and then get more complex, tying the things you learned together and challenging you in creative ways. Thats not here at all. There are maybe 4 levels which are tricky and take some thinking, with the rest of the levels being simplistic and unrewarding.

Overall if you want an engaging story with witty writing, get this. If you are expecting clever puzzles which test your intelligence, and involve lots of interesting elements, dont bother. I wanted the latter and was sorely disappointed.

Super fun, and contains a lot of depth! I had some trouble around the middle to later chapters of the game, but that's because I'm an idiot, and as of recently I do fully understand each puzzle. The first time you finish a puzzle it makes you feel like a gigabrain god but instead you just solved a level in a popular Valve game. The dialogue and jokes in this game never cease to make me laugh, even after 10+ playthroughs. The multiplayer is very fun, but can be very difficult if your friend is an asshole >:/ (talkin about you Geordge) . The level creator and workshop allows the full creativity of the community to flourish, and it rocks. Play this game if you wanna have a good first-person puzzle game experience.
It's portal, what else is there to say?

Portal 2 is like Portal 1. It's a masterpiece and an absolute treasure. There's two separate modes, single player and co-op. I'll start with what I played first, the co-op.

It took me and my friend about 3 or 4 weeks to finish it, playing every Saturday night. I think it added up to around 15 hours, but you could probably do it faster if you're not fucking retarded like us. Jk we're living gods and aced every level. Certainly didn't spend half an hour on a single part of a level. And those puzzles are amazing. Pretty much every single one felt creative in a way, and not once did I think that something was far too vague or specific. Valve really made use of every single mechanic in every possible way.

I really had a lot of fun playing the co-op. I want a Portal 2.5. Or a portal more than 2 less than 4. Your pick, Valve.

I honestly didn't think the single player would hold up compared to the co-op, but shit, it was better. I absolutely loved the story, the characters felt fleshed out, and the level design? It is amazing beyond words. Every single cutscene was better than most hollywood blockbusters, even if their very short length limit stopped them from topping masterpieces like District 9 or Rango. If you don't like those movies, you probably won't like Portal 2 either, because you have unbelievably bad taste. Fix yourself.

The game is truly unforgettable. I'd like to call it a contemporary masterpiece, but a quick search of the phrase online shows it being used like exclusively for houses. Go figure.

There is very little doubt on whether you should play it first or not. The only reason you shouldn't play this game is if you haven't played Portal 1, in which case you should preferably play that first. 10/10 I treasure it like I treasure the last parting gifts from my friends the last day I saw them. Very much. I'm glad I pulled this out of my backlog and played it before I died or lost my hands or something.

The game has a really great story before the events of portal 1 and 2 take place.
I really enjoyed this game and this is one of my favorite steam games of all times.
The story of Caroline that was forced by cave jhonson in order to be a robot to beat black mesa was really sad.
The ending is also tearful because Chell doesnt know what has happened to the outside world while being in the aperture science facillity. You experience quite a lot of feelings in the game when you look at the lore behind aperture science. This game is really good and I enjoyed it a lot. My favorite character is GLaDOS.

I just finished this game and wow. It has an extremely interesting story that really keeps you wondering what will happen next and how is it going to end. Mainly focused on puzzles but comedy plays a really big part in the story and the game manages to execute that perfectly. I haven't played co-op yet but it looks just as fun as the campaign. 10/10 its really well priced for the content it brings to the buyer.

In my personal opinion this is the best game of all time
